#Text=The Golden State Warriors continued to dominate on Thursday , defeating the Dallas Mavericks , 112 - 97 , at Oracle Arena .
#Text=Golden State ( 23 - 6 ) is without a two time - MVP in Stephen Curry ( ankle ) , but their play has hardly suffered in his absence .
#Text=On Thursday , the team notched its eighth consecutive win , making things look easy against a struggling Mavericks team .
#Text=Superstar forward Kevin Durant continued to shine with Curry sidelined , pouring in a team - high 36 points on 15 - of - 23 shooting .
#Text=Durant , who has evolved his game to become a stellar rim protector , blocked three shots as well .
#Text=Though the team held only a seven - point lead through three quarters , the Warriors were able to maintain a comfortable lead throughout the fourth to earn the win .
#Text=All-Star guard Klay Thompson helped the team pull away with the game , knocking down four consecutive three - pointers in the quarter to expand the Warriors ' lead .
#Text=Thompson was a perfect 5 - of - 5 from beyond the arc on the night .
#Text=Dallas ( 8 - 21 ) was missing their own Curry brother , as well as a number of other key rotation players .
#Text=Seth Curry ( leg ) , Dennis Smith , Jr. ( hip ) , and Dorian Finney-Smith ( knee ) were all sidelined for the loss .
#Text=Even when healthy , though , this Mavericks team has seen its share of struggles .
#Text=Dallas owns the Western Conference 's worst record and the third - worst win total in the NBA .
#Text=On Thursday , the team put up a strong effort through three quarters to limit the Golden State lead to single digits .
#Text=However , in the fourth quarter , perimeter defense proved to be a problem for the team , as a barrage of shots from deep sunk Dallas 's chances of winning .
#Text=Veteran star Dirk Nowitzki led the team with 18 points in the game , and the German big man added nine rebounds .
#Text=The Mavericks will face off against the San Antonio Spurs on Saturday , while Golden State will take on the Los Angeles Lakers on Monday .
